Professor Hamilton recently wrote: Debt ceiling politics If you have a concrete proposal to raise tax revenue or cut spending, then put it on the table. But if you simply want to grandstand on the debt ceiling as if it were a stand-alone issue, it is clear that you have nothing but contempt for the voters. â¢ A recent article on NY Times about "discussions" on state bankruptcies. : America's Pursuit of Power in the Middle East" last year, writes in the online analysis in great detail about various aspects of the war with a special emphasis on the war's ending. A year after the war, Saddam Hussein mocked President Bush from Baghdad and claimed victory: "It was George H.W. Bush with his own will who decided to stop the fighting. Nobody had asked him to do so.' Seizing on that appearance of presidential weakness, Bill Clinton campaigned that year against President Bush - and beat him- chiding George H.W. Bush for not putting Saddam Hussein and his acolytes on trial for war crimes. " Bill Clinton would prove no more effective than George H.W. Bush in removing Saddam Hussein , Geoffrey Wawro noted.
